description: IPA Master Phoneme Table - Frame mappings for SoundMirror

a.name: Open A
a.description: "ah" sound - open mouth, tongue low and flat

i.name: Close Front I
i.description: "ee" sound - lips spread wide, tongue high and front

u.name: Close Back U
u.description: "oo" sound - lips rounded tight, tongue high and back

o.name: Close-Mid O
o.description: "oh" sound - lips rounded, tongue mid-back, held without glide

y.name: Close Front Rounded
y.description: Rounded "ee" - tongue position of /i/ with rounded lips

p.name: Bilabial Plosive
p.description: "p" sound - complete lip closure, then burst release

t.name: Alveolar Plosive
t.description: "t" sound - tongue tip touches alveolar ridge behind upper teeth

d.name: Voiced Alveolar Plosive
d.description: "d" sound - same mouth position as /t/, but voiced

k.name: Velar Plosive
k.description: "k" sound - back of tongue touches soft palate (velum)

g.name: Voiced Velar Plosive
g.description: "g" sound - same mouth position as /k/, but voiced

ʔ.name: Glottal Stop
ʔ.description: Glottal stop - closure in throat, no oral obstruction

n.name: Alveolar Nasal
n.description: "n" sound - tongue tip at alveolar ridge, air through nose

ŋ.name: Velar Nasal
ŋ.description: "ng" sound - back of tongue raised to velum, air through nose

s.name: Alveolar Fricative
s.description: "s" sound - tongue near alveolar ridge, hissing airflow

ʃ.name: Postalveolar Fricative
ʃ.description: "sh" sound - lips slightly rounded, tongue further back than /s/

θ.name: Dental Fricative
θ.description: "th" (voiceless) - tongue tip between teeth, air flows over

f.name: Labiodental Fricative
f.description: "f" sound - lower lip touches upper teeth, air flows through

h.name: Glottal Fricative
h.description: "h" sound - open breath, no obstruction in mouth

r.name: Alveolar Approximant
r.description: "r" sound (American) - tongue curled back slightly, no contact

l.name: Alveolar Lateral
l.description: "l" sound - tongue tip at ridge, air flows around sides

ɬ.name: Voiceless Lateral Fricative
ɬ.description: Welsh "ll" - air flows around tongue with friction

ǃ.name: Dental Click
ǃ.description: Dental click - tongue tip creates suction against teeth
